newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Technicals send SIMEX Nikkei plummetting.
newsitem.headline: Technicals send SIMEX Nikkei plummetting.

text.p: Weak technicals, which triggered a wave of selling, sent SIMEX Nikkei March futures plummetting more than 500 points to rest precariously over its psychological support level of 18,000, dealers said on Thursday.
"It was strictly technicals and the way the stops were situated which set off a wave of reaction," a dealer said.
After hitting a high of 18,770, the benchmark Nikkei 225 March contract ended down 525 points at 18,155 on a turnover of 18,800.
It saw some selling around 18,500 in the afternoon ahead of the options expiration in Osaka, dealers said.
"The futures tend to gravitate towards the (option) strike price ahead of the expiration," the dealer said. "In this case, it was 18,500."
Dealers said major Japanese and European institutions were among active sellers, and were soon joined by nervous locals.
"When March fell below 18,500, technicals overtook and stops triggered, sending the futures below 18,100," said the dealer.

The March contract was expected to consolidate around the 18,000 level for the next couple of days. An upward rally was expected given a lack of new bearish domesitic news, dealers said. -- Angela Tan (65 8703083)
